Walter White was never meant to wear a white hat, but the man who would become Heisenberg was still someone “Breaking Bad” fans rooted for — to a point.
But time and distance can reshape perspective… [+2176 chars]

articles.title: Fetty Wap Pleads Guilty to Conspiring With a Long Island Drug Gang - The New York Times
articles.description: The rapper, who had parlayed a hit record about selling drugs into widespread stardom, conspired to distribute more than 500 grams of cocaine in New Jersey, prosecutors said.

articles.title: Blondie on the Music That Defined Its Legacy - The New York Times
articles.description: Debbie Harry, Chris Stein and their bandmates built a career rooted in wit, excitement, pastiche and sex. A new boxed set, “Against the Odds: 1974-1982,” traces their journey.
articles.content: When they released their first album in 1976, Harry was 31 and Stein was almost 27, which was ancient per punk standards. But the material improved in subsequent years, especially with Dreaming, one … [+1702 chars]
